title: 🏸 "You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated." - Maya Angelou
content:
(thanks to Tom!): You’re trying to build an IoT mesh network. Signals can only travel the maximum of 5 units. You’re given coordinates for the switch, the light, and the mesh hubs (which capture and forward signals). Return true if the switch can successfully toggle the light.

Example:

let network = { switch: [0,1], hub: [[2,1], [2,5]], light: [1,6] } $ canToggle(network) $ true

If you want a more visual example, here’s a diagram. In this example, canToggle would return false because the red circles don’t connect in the middle, with the blue triangle being the switch, and the green being the light!
